title: Album Page, "Structure with Pointed Arch from Chapel at Amboise, France", late 19th century
medium: Graphite on off-white wove paper with pre-printed blue ink ruled lines, mounted to thick, off-white laid paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, on lined sheet: bottom right corner: chapel at Amboise / 121; upper right corner: 128; upper center edge: on top of this is / the small canopy; below: Inside / Length / Breadth.
dimensions:
Sheet: 21.4 x 17.2 cm (8 7/16 x 6 3/4 in.), irregular
Mount: 31.9 x 24.2 cm (12 9/16 x 9 1/2 in.), irregular
description: Vertical sheet illustrating a small table pierced by tri-cusped Gothic arch in center, and with small diamond-shaped notches carved out of the spandrel corners surrounding the arch.  Above this is a three part moulding that makes up the table top.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Structure with Pointed Arch from Chapel at Amboise, France", late 19th century.Graphite on off-white wove paper with pre-printed blue ink ruled lines, mounted to thick, off-white laid paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-297.
